oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Now hear this, circa 1962
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An original political cartoon created by Jack Knox, the Nashville Banner editorial cartoonist from the mid-1940s to the early 1970s. The cartoon compares the Eisenhower and Kennedy administrations in regards to the increase of new employees in the Federal bureaucracy. In the first of the two panels, labeled "Nov. 1960," Kennedy shows John Q. Public that Eisenhower added 106,000 new employees in eight years. The second panel, labeled "Dec. 1962," depicts John Q. Public vociferously announcing that Kennedy added 143,618 in seventeen months. Forms part of the Jack Knox Political Cartoon Collection. 1 original cartoon drawing : b & w ; 14.5 x 20 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Kennedy, John F. (John Fitzgerald), 1917-1963--Caricatures and cartoons
